posts.author: Mubo
posts.content: This build has been a undefinable to me for a little over a year now. There's a weapon made specifically for Strength Monk builds. But as far as I can tell, there is NO possible way to make a Strength Monk. I know the quarterstaff is a weak weapon on Arelith, but I'm ignoring that for now. I need someone to not only show me how this works, but also show me a 1-30 formatted build for a quarterstaff Monk. It doesn't have to be.. the -best-, for pvp, I don't think that's possible. But having it be at least passable would be good enough for me. One last thing, though. Please.. don't tell me to go Half-Orc. I'll kill myself if that's what I have to do to make it work.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Do monks on Arelith get the unarmed attack progression with a quarterstaff like with they do with kamas? I am thinking that Dwarf would be a good race for this. I think I remember that a Bard can be lawful on Arelith, so a Monk 15 / Bard 5 / RDD 10 would be awesome not only because of the +8 STR but also because the +4 AC from RDD helps compensate for the loss of DEX AC from making a STR-based Monk, but I also remember that RDD is hard to get. Still, it just might be worth jumping through those hoops to get RDD in this case.

posts.author: Mubo
posts.content: No, Monk attack progression will be less. You cannot use Flurry of Blows with a Quarterstaff. Doing RDD sounds completely impossible, considering Areliths rules.The Dwarf race doesn't appeal to me at all, but I'm open to accept that if Human isn't possible with the build. I'd honestly rather quit trying the build for Arelith. I don't think it will work out the way I want it if I keep trying.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Mubo, first of all welcome to the guild ;-)

Now for your Monk build it would help us a lot if you could post some information regarding the specific rules about quarterstaves and whether you are willing-or-not to multi-class. Race isn't a big thing, Human will work fine as long as the build is good. Are you happy with playing a human or you would like something more exotic like an Elf? I want to tell you beforehand though, that a Monk is best when used as either with his unarmed strikes or with kamas. Everything else will be inherently weaker than those two choices. Also, a Quarterstaff is a large weapon in default Neverwiinter Nights and not a double-sided weapon, that means you will have to use it as a Greatsword but with way lower damage and critical range. So, unless Arelith have changed that, you will be a lot weaker than normal. We can build a STR-based Monk easily though, don't worry about that part.

Hmm, here is a suggestion for you. If you would like to use an uncommon weapon that looks like a Quarterstaff but has better stats and allows for improved two-weapon fighting, we can make you a STR-based Monk build with a Dire-Mace instead. How is that sounds to you?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
Here's another idea: Monk 15 / Fighter 8 / Weapon Master 7. Human would work, but Dwarf would be better. That quarterstaff had better be spectacular to be worth making such a sub-optimal build to accommodate it.

EDIT: This post was made having not seen Valerfor's post. I am not rejecting what he had to say.

posts.content: Heh, it is as i was suspecting it would be then. Not worth your time mubo, better to role-play at least something that has some potential as well. I can think a couple of build choices for your character but i also liked Empyre's WM choice. Empyre would you be so kind as to make a Weapon Master of Dire Mace while i will proceed with a (Fighter 4/ Monk 20/ CoT 6) build? I think two choices will be better than one for mubo.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I'd be happy to make that build, but it will have to wait until later, maybe even not today. I have company coming in a while. If I don't do it today, I'll do it tomorrow for sure.

posts.author: Mubo
posts.content: I definitely like the top one the most out of the four. It has a decent balance of Monk and Fighter. I was torn for a while on the first and second build, I love lots of Fighter levels because more Fighter means more Feats. But I like the more even levels of the two basic classes from the first build. As for the other two, they're considerable since UMD is pretty essential. But I don't really like the heavy armor appeal.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: I posted the first two because that is what you asked for, and the last two because they are better. The heavy armor gives you 4 more AC than the first build and 5 more AC than the second build, and thanks to UMD, you can still wear Monk boots. If Monk fits your role-play better, then go ahead and play the first build, but know that you will get hit a lot more.

Hey brother!

this idea is kind of good, but TBH I would stop CoT at 26 if you must have so many levels of it (22 would be a bit better). The AC you'll get from ONE more Monk level is worth the saves decrease and one epic feat (which you can recover by going 2 more Fighter, PLUS you can get Improved Knockdown for free with Monk 6, so you lose a bit of saves, but you gain 2 feats and at least 6 Tumble AC), so I'd go for Fighter 8 Monk 6 CoT 26 as a better spread, maintaining the pre-epic spread 6-4-10 and starting with Monk for more skill points. Good thing is that build has SO MANY FEATS that you can take all pre-epic save-boosting feats like Luck of Heroes and Great Fortitude, Lightning Reflexes and Iron Will pretty much free of charge. Improved Power Attack, Improved Disarm and Improved Expertise are all within your reach as well!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Actually, you gain your last Bonus Feat at CoT 22, so might as well trade those 2 CoT (23 and 24) for 2 Fighter for one more feat. Ftr 6 Monk 12 CoT 22 is a bit more optimal. The CoT bonus counts towards the cap, so after a while (and factoring items that increase the ability modifiers) too much of it becomes redundant. Improved evasion is actually not really good on your toon because he has such high saves that he'll never fail a Reflex save, so only Evasion is more than enough (Improved evasion usefulness is for low-dex, low save types and as a requirement for Epic Dodge, which you don't get). Are Diamond Body and Diamond soul worth the extra investment? To me no, but the Monk Speed increases at 9 and 12 might be, how about you, what are your thoughts?

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Evasion avoids all damage instead of the default half if you make the save (for spells and effects that allow a Reflex save for half damage). Improved Evasion does the same, but also avoids half the damage if you fail the save. If you are always going to make the save, Improved Evasion is not better than Evasion.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Valerfor wrote:
There is, unless you build for instant level 40 power, you would want IKD way before the 37th level, as i have done with my Dwarven Fighter/Monk/CoT.
This is true, but also there are many other things you can think about: Improved Evasion is a Requirement for Epic Dodge, which is a DEX toon's must-have-if-possible dream feat, so in builds with Rogue or Shadowdancer, 9 levels of Monk is pretty much a no-brainer. Every 3 Monk levels you gain a 10% movespeed increase if it adds up AND your UNARMED damage goes up, all the way to 16th level, when it maxes out at d20. So yes, there are reasons to absolutely go above 6, many, in fact, it's just a matter of prioritizing. You already know what you would gain by going more Monk. How about by adding more levels in the other classes, what would you gain with that? Compare and decide! Everything in NWN about priorities. Fighter gives more feats, methinks this build has plenty. CoT gives feats, saves and Divine Wrath increases (which after level 22 will max out your saves when buffed with Divine Wrath), so Monk 16 (for maxed Unarmed damage and a much higher movespeed is a good choice, plus you gain all these bonuses! Monk 16 / Fighter 6 / CoT 18 is a good spread for an unarmed build with these classes. 12/6/22 is a good spread for a *COUGH* Quarterstaff Monk. :D

Take it EZ!
